name: Hotel Piet Hein

reviews.text: I honestly cannot say enough good things about this hotel. When I booked my room, I requested a room with a view overlooking the street. I was quite impressed that despite the hotel being very busy when I was there, they did meet my request.
reviews.title: Fantastic... Book now!!!

reviews.text: I arrived early for check-in by about about 40 mins and they informed me that my room wasn't ready yet. They offered me a drink (free of charge), and after a 5 or 10 minute wait, the room was ready.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: The room itself, was lovely, very clean and comfortable. Very modern, and with a flatscreen tv on the wall above my bed. The view from the window as I mentioned earlier was overlooking the street and the adjacent Vondelpark. Could hear a wee bit of noise but nothing that kept me awake.
reviews.title: My third trip to Hotel Piet Hein

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and were able to recommend some good restaurants nearby. The location was a little bit out but only about a five minute walk from the Leidseplein where there were many cafes, bars etc and most importantly a tram stop!
reviews.title: More than a 3 star in many ways

reviews.text: If you're in Amsterdam for a couple of days and want a GREAT location and don't mind a small room, this is the place. It is two blocks from the Rjiksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. I walked all over the city from the hotel. The staff are very helpful, particularly Martina.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel a find

reviews.text: Booked this hotel because the website looked very well. But in fact the hotel was too bad. The room was small en very sober with a tiny window facing a wall. Breakfast was nothing special. The hotel is claiming to be a trendy design hotel, but there is nothing trendy in the hotel! Especially the rooms are far from that. It is very overrated I think. The only good thing is the location: opposite Vondelpark in a very good, central neighbourhood.
reviews.title: This is not a trendy designhotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed there for 1 night in a double room.
reviews.title: awesome and affordable

reviews.text: very pleasant atmosphere and helping staff.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.text: room was pretty big, but cousy and well decorated (if anyone finds it important).
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bathroom was clean and shiny.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.text: My teenage daughter and I stayed at Hotel Piet Hein for 2 nights in July 2008. Our room was excellent: clean, plenty of room, wonderful bedding, big bay window with view of the park... Only problem was the 4-inch step leading into the bathroom! VERY DANGEROUS!! I did fall once, and thank goodness did not get hurt. That aside, everything was wonderful. EXCELLENT breakfast!! GREAT location - we could have walked everywhere, but we took the Canal Bus (fun and informative) to explore the city.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a delicious Indonesian dinner at the Orient (right around the corner). We were able to take an airport bus to the airport (it made regular stops at the hostel next door) for 8 euros!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at this hotel

likes.disliked: — No one helped us with our luggage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four nights here in July. We highly recommend this hotel to others who are looking for a moderate-priced hotel in Amsterdam. It is a short walk to the Van Gogh, the Rijksmuseum, Leidseplein, and the #5 tram. The rooms are clean and comfortable, a good breakfast buffet is included, Internet is free, and the ladies at the front desk are helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great hotel, lovely staff

likes.liked: — The really comfortable bed, and the wonderful staff

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Piet Hein in February 2008 for a long weekend. We loved the Piet Hein - the room was gorgeous. It was big, the bed was huge and very comfortable, we had a great flat screen TV. The bathroom was great, and everything was spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Good value & location; helpful staff but very basic rooms

likes.disliked: — small room; no AC; few electric outlets; no bag holder

reviews.text: The breakfast was lovely, plenty of variety, great quality. The reception staff were very nice - they provided us with a map when we checked in, and marked the hotel location on it as well as some directions for us to get to various locations we might want to see. We later asked for restaurant recommendations, and we ended up in a fantastic place - I'm afraid I can't remember what it was called, but it was an excellent choice. They also helped us with the metro. The barman was also great, very friendly and chatty. There was free internet access in the lobby area.
reviews.title: Wonderful little gem, with some minor flaws

likes.liked: — The great staff and the quiet location to points of interest.
likes.disliked: — VERY step steps coming into hotel.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Great little hotel, excellent location, friendly staff. Could do with tea/coffee making facilities in rooms though...

We stayed at the Piet Hein this spring and I can confirm that the service was bad. We decided that we would be taking de luxe rooms, because the standard rooms were too small. The room was OK, and quiet ( a luxus these days, it seems !). Our room was on the -1 floor, and we had very nice view on a little inside garden.The Dutch Breakfast was OK, but the staff lacked friendliness. The reason why we WILL NOT RETURN TO PIET HEIN ( and therefore DO NOT RECOMMAND IT) is the following :
reviews.title: Average Accomodation but very bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A young receptionnist booked us a tour to the famous Dutch Mills and told us to show up the next day at 13.15 in front of the hotel. So we did and discovered that he had booked us instead on the morning tour and that we couldn't go in the afternoon. The receptionnist that attended us that day - a young lady- told us that she was sorry.- She arranged for us to go in the afternoon anyway and since we were running out of time, she offered to pay us the taxi ... but she said, the taxi fee will be deducted from the receptionist salary.- Since I worked in the hotel business and knew how little people make, we said it would be OK to take the tram ( it was only 10-15 mn away). She thanked us and say that she WOULD MAKE IT UP TO US.... When we returned that day, the young receptionist was there again, he purposely turned his back on us, pretended to be busy, and NEVER TALKED TO US AGAIN. When we checked out, I told the story and asked what THEY COULD DO TO MAKE IT UP TO US...We asked several times, AND THEY SAID THAT THEY DID NOT KNOW WHAT WE WERE TALKING ABOUT... A little effort on their part would have greatly been appreciated... but nobody seemed to care ... So, PIET HEIN ? Thanks, but NO THANKS!
reviews.title: Don't Book On-line from the US

reviews.text: Nice hotel with good location and breakfast. Prices were signifcantly lower if you walk in vs booking on-line which I thought was unfair. Small rooms for price.
reviews.title: Timing & Location

reviews.text: This was our 3rd trip to Amsterdam in the last 5 years and was definitely our worst accomodation. The hotel had some wonderful assets like new bathrooms, nice Dutch breakfast and an attempt at chic, but the negatives far outweighed the positives. We were treated with total indifference and a slight abruptness at check-in. We were used to a very pleasant welcome on previous visits at other hotels in Amsterdam. For the price we were paying 150+ Euros/night per room we were disappointed to be in a room that had workmen building a scaffolding inches from our room's only window on the 2nd floor below ground level (-2). From 7:15- 5:30 the workers were singing, banging, clanging, and shouting. Also the sidewalk and road were blocked daily by the construction work. Apparently the PH is annexing the neighboring building. We had 2 rooms on the same floor and in the second room you could not hear the construction clatter. The room we had was either 200 or 210 ans was one to avoid! We will NOT stay there again. There are too many better values and locations to be found next time in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located in one the better parts of Amsterdam and it shows. No busy streets, close to all important attractions Amsterdam has to offer and now weird people wandering around at night.
reviews.title: Good stay

likes.liked: — The umbrella I stole and the quiet surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is well trained and polite (they lent me a very nice umbrella when it rained - which I of course kept).
reviews.title: Nice little hotel
Good tourist base, not for asthmatics
reviews.text: Our room was a bit small but otherwise nice.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: LaiYee

reviews.text: This cute little hotel is in a quiet location. Unfortunately, the renovations are not yet complete and the noise from construction was a bit disruptive. Fortunately, we had no issues with smoke odors in our room (3rd floor). The beds are very comfy. The rooms are not large, but tastefully decorated. The location is great for people who want to visit the museums. There are many shops within walking distance and (if you're in average shape) you can basically walk anywhere in the city within a half hour. Bring a good map because it's easy to get lost. The staff were pleasant and spoke English well. The cold breakfast buffet is perfectly edible. I would stay here again, provided the construction is over & done with.
reviews.title: Can't Wait to Go Back

reviews.text: I would agree with all that has been written in the previous recent reviews. I would like to add a few small grips though. I booked 2 executive single rooms through the hotel web site and requested that if possible could the rooms be on the same floor. At check in we were told that this would not be possible, but the next day one of the staff told me that the hotel was not full. In one of our rooms the safe would not work. The receptionist informed us that this could not be resolved. In the other room the tv remote control was missing and it took 3 visits to reception and 24 hours before one was provided. The carpets were badly stained in both rooms. We did enjoy our stay in the hote however. As the other reviews have stated it is clean and in a good location, a good buffet breakfast is provided and there is free internet in the lobby. Note that while we were there in early May, there were renovation works going on in the hotel, but the noise didn't start until after 9am.
reviews.title: average hotel, could improve

likes.liked: — location - near museums and tram stops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate her birthday last weekend.On arrival we were greated by a helpful man on reception who immediately wished my wife a happy birthday (we had mentioned this on booking). The room we were given was at the rear of the hotel and had a balcony.It was a large room with what appeared to be a newly fitted bathroom suite which had a very nice shower ! The hotel staff had also left a complimentary bottle of wine and card to wish my wife a happy birthday - what a nice touch and I doubt that many other hotels would have done that.There is also a nice relaxing bar area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Ideal Location

reviews.text: We felt the breakfast (cereals, fresh fruit, cheese, ham, rolls, eggs,jam and cofee, tea & juices) was very good especially when the deal we had included the breakfast for less than the cost of many 'accommodation only' deals we had looked at.The breakfast room was nice and also appeared to have been recently refurbished.The hotel itself is situated in a nice location - a quiet street right alongside Vondelpark (though this is currently being relandscapped where the hotel is situated). To get to the hotel you need get tram 2 or 5 from centraal station and get off at the Van Gough museum or the stop just before (I cant remember the name of this one though). The Leidesplein is only a 5/10 minute walkaway where there are plenty of bars and restaurants.Pretty much everywhere in Amsterdam is walkable if you are reasonably fit and I feel sure that if you stay at this hotel you will enjoy your stay.
reviews.title: Affordable and clean, only little rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They always book me at this hotel while I attend the Hortifair in AMsterdam.
reviews.title: Just where we wanted to be!

reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located, not too close to the RAI.Breakfast is ok but self service.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel in Wonderful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location. Good value. Rooms a bit on the small side but then....this is Europe. Staff were a bit clueless when it came to why the computers in the lobby were not printing but other than that, very friendly. The only bad thing is the fact that staff seem to congregate and smoke in the entrance foyer, lobby and bar area and unfortunately, with the staircase being where it is, the smell of smoke permeates the entire building. Our clothes ended up smelling of smoke INSIDE our cupboard in our room and neither of us smoke.... Should give you some idea as to how strong the smell actually was.
reviews.title: Good value

likes.disliked: — Bad ventilation and smell of smoke

reviews.text: A case of getting exactly what you are promised.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, tiny, clean rooms.
reviews.title: Nice, little well located hotel

reviews.text: Great value, at under Euro 80.
reviews.title: Well chilled

likes.liked: — Close to museums, relaxed, clean, recently refurbished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have never seen the 'no bathtub' shower, it's an additional perk.
reviews.title: Good location

likes.disliked: — The very dark walls and carpets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was alright. They seemed understaffed at times - the person working did his best but there was too much work for one person. The bathroom in the room was very nice, but the carpet in the room needed to be replaced. I saw a mouse running through the bar area. Overall, I might stay here again. It was okay, but for the price it was not great.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.text: I placed my booking via the hotel website itself, as my friend, who lives in Amsterdam now, suggested it as it was very close to where she and her fiance (now husband) lived. She didn't know too much about it, only that it was nice and quaint and right next to the park and close to Van Gogh Museum, as I was going there for her wedding and to give her a hand in the preparation, I was absolutely ready to put up with whatever as long as it wasn't too expensive, and that it was clean and not too far from everything else.
reviews.title: It will now be my hotel whenever I stay in Amsterdam
Charming, Great Value
reviews.text: Initial impression over the internet was wonderful, they were friendly and efficient, and got in touch with me very quickly, and took note of any request that I placed and repeated them all back to me in their e-mail of confirmation. I then didn't think about it and got on with life until it was time for me to leave for the airport.

It was just as lovely as my friend said and more so, as she had never been in there. I love a fry up breakfast every now and then, though the hotel did not provide that, they provided plenty others, fresh produce, fruits, cereals, breads, eggs, cold cuts, the whole place from top to bottom was spotless, and I never saw a sour face among the staffs, including the chambermaid, who wouldn't take the tips that I left out on the table until I saw her and gave it to her personally.
reviews.title: If I had a hammer...

reviews.text: The bar area was small but cosy and big enough for entertainment, on nights when I didn't fancy going out due to the torrential rain, I hung out at the bar with fellow travellers, the bar man was always in good spirit and endlessly amusing and fun. It was all in all such a wonderful experience that I'll recommend it to anyone who'd listen, and I hope to see some of you there and be as charmed by it as I am.
reviews.title: **Please read- You will thank us...**

likes.disliked: — noise, theft, lack of knowledge or assistance by the staff

description: Star rating is 3 stars and not 1 star for 25 years already. Since 2008 we have 81 rooms.
